p: The most often performed activity was administering medications ordered by a doctor, including injections and medication drips ( n = 179; 88.6%) in the PHC clinic setting. Less frequent activities included recognizing patients’ nursing needs and health problems ( n = 176; 87.1%) and monitoring, assessing, and interpreting basic vital signs ( n = 172; 85.1%). The list of 10 most often performed tasks reported by the participants is presented in Table 3. The least often performed tasks are reported in Table 4 and include: issuing of referrals for specific diagnostic tests ( n = 128; 63.4%) followed by ordering specific medicinal products ( n = 106; 52.5%) and bladder rinse ( n = 77; 38.1%).
